benchmark_details.name: ECV A (Exploring the Causation of Video Anomalies)
benchmark_details.overview: ECV A is a comprehensive benchmark for causation understanding of video anomalies, consisting of 2,240 video clips with detailed human annotations. It addresses the 'what', 'why', and 'how' of video anomalies.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a large-scale benchmark for causation understanding of video anomalies.

data.source: Crawled from video platforms such as Bilibili and YouTube.
data.annotation: Manually annotated with detailed descriptions of anomalies, causes, and effects.

methodology.calculation: AnomEval assesses the ability of VLMs to understand anomalous events based on a combination of basic reasoning, consistency, and hallucination checks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores on AnomEval indicate better understanding of the causative relationships in video anomalies.
methodology.baseline_results: AnomShield achieved state-of-the-art performance on the ECV A benchmark.
